column2: VIRGINIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: stop doing what they are doing.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. This road sign means:
4. The picture shows:
5. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 6. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column6: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: The same as a green light.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. This sign indicates:
column4: Do not use your phone while driving

column2: 10. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 11. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 12. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column8: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column10: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 13. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 15. A motorist arriving at the intersection must yield the right of way to motorists who arrived before him.
16. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To decrease the state average speed statistic.

column2: 17. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column10: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.

column2: 18. The speed limit in residential zones is:
19. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column6: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 20. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.

column2: 21. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 22. Alcohol:
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 23. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
24. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column10: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 25. Cell phones can be a cause of distracted driving.
26. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 27. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
28. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column6: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 29. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column8: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 30. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column8: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column10: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 31. Children under the age of ___ must be secured in an approved child safety seat.
32. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 33. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
34. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column10: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 35. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column6: Only if the light is green.
column10: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 36. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 37. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: use only one hand on the wheel.
column10: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 38. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 39. Who is most at risk?
column8: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 40. Always wear your shoulder strap seat belt:
